Reviews.Title: “Very nice Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bseifert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we went to Silver Dollar City this past summer. The room was very nice and clean, and it was nice to not stay on the main strip with all the noise and traffic. We loved sitting outside on the deck area, and we loved how quiet and nice it was there. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Dleep
Reviews.Content: I love the location away from all the hustle and bustle, but in only a few minutes you are back in town. The view from this ridge top is outstanding. My wife and I have stayed here several times, we love all the themed rooms. The breakfast is outstanding. When we want a nice quiet get away, this is our go to place.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Janice C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 14 yrs ago the first time, in the Rose room I think, it had a Rose stained glass window. We had homemade waffles for breakfast, and the owner's children (one was a blonde curly headed angel) were running around as we ate. Lovely family atmosphere, loved the view from our balcony every night when we came in. God called us to the mission field on that balcony, we knew He had a special plan for us, we just didn't know how or why. We have been part-time missionaries to Mexico for about 11 yrs now, and we have seen so much. We returned to Bradford Inn one other trip, and we plan to book a room this Oct when we get away for a little R&R. We've stayed in other places over the years as well, but none compare to the Bradford. It just feels like home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “You Should Check This One Out”
Reviews.Author: DinkinsGrange
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel (though it is more like a bed and breakfast) several times in the past, as I pick up my daughter from summer camp. The place never changes, and that is a good thing. This is the place to stay if you want to relax, as it is quiet and comfortable. It is less than 10 minutes from the westerly end of Branson, and about the same distance from Silver Dollar City. It does not have a weight room or swimming pool, but that was OK with me. My wife joined me on this trip, and she agrees, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelsalotMissouri
Reviews.Content: A peaceful setting with a nice view of Branson and the hills. Clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. On the West side of Branson out of all of the traffic and noise

Reviews.Title: “BBB--Best Bed n Branson!”
Reviews.Author: tottboys
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for lavish and expensive then the Bradford Inn is not for you. If you are looking for clean, quiet, friendly, romantic, cozy, and inviting then you have found the right place. We have stayed here 3 or 4 times over the last several years and always find this place consistently Great! Breakfast is good, rooms are very nice, and everyone is very friendly and appreciates you choosing to stay at their inn. I would recommend this place to a friend or anyone who is looking for something different than a standard motel room. And, one more thing, their beds are the most comfortable beds in town!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to relax after SDC”
Reviews.Author: quartet9903
Reviews.Content: The Bradford Inn has 33 rooms, all in different themes. Prices are great and the Breakfast is Fantastic. Cooked to order by the owner. We have stayed there many times and have always enjoyed it and there is a wonderful view overlooking Branson from the Gazebo. I would recommend it over the many resorts we have stayed in over the last 30 years visiting Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Best B&B in Branson”
Reviews.Author: angels622
Reviews.Content: Bradford Inn is one of the best B&B's in Branson. Bob, the owner cooks a marvelous homemade breakfast each morning, and if you're lucky his wife may have cooked some of her scrumptious peach muffins. The Bradford Inn is located between the busy main drag and Silver Dollar City. It's a perfect place to get away from all the busy areas and have some quiet in between all the fun. They are located on top of a mountain which gives you a beautiful view of Branson especially at night. You are minutes from SDC too. Each room has it's own decor which makes you feel right at home. It's a must place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable... with a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ploethen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location close to Silver Dollar City. Our room was clean and the breakfast was cooked to order. Very popular with the 70 - 80 crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to Stay - Comfort and Personal Attention of a Bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DinkinsGrange
Reviews.Content: There are 3 family facilities in the Branson, MO area that are owned by the Westfall family. They are the Bradford Inn, Bradford House, and Bradford on the Lake. My daughter and I stayed at the Bradford Inn for the 3rd time this year. My daughter says this place is her "favorite place to stay". When she says it's her favorite place to stay, she is not limiting this to Branson. It is simply her favorite place to stay. You will not find a lounge, game room, or swimming pool here. But what you will find is the most charming, quaint, out of the way place you will remember for a long time. If you want noise, lots of people and night life, then you want to be in the middle of Branson. But if you want something that is quiet, for the best night's sleep you have ever had, with a view of Branson from atop the ridge the hotel is built on, then don't pass this one up. The rooms are themed room that can be viewed on their web site. The hotel was built by Robert Westfall, and expertly decorated by his wife. From the time you drive through the white fence onto the property, you can't help but be charmed by the landscaping. And then you go to the other side of the hotel, and look down on Branson about a mile away. And if this wasn't enough, just wait until the night, when the lights of Branson fill the skyline. What a site. My particular room had a Safari theme. The room included a small refrigerator, an ironing board, and upon request, an iron. The refrigerator was nice for snacks, as the hotel is up the road a little ways from the nearest store or restaurant. In the morning, the owner, Robert Westfall, personally cooks up breakfast. You can tell, he really enjoys it too -- what a way to start the day. While he has a full commercial looking kitchen, he actually cooks up eggs on the counter in front of you on a griddle, while carrying on a conversation with his guest. He really is that personable. And the breakfast doesn't stop with eggs, he has cinnamon rolls, sausage, biscuits, sausage gravy, cereals, milk, orange juice, and, well, I'm sure I'm forgetting something...Oh, yeh, coffee (probably still forgetting something). He also serves lunch a few days a week, however, I was always out and about around lunch time. The other facilities owned by this family I understand are just as nice as the Bradford Inn. You may want to try each of them, but for me, it's hard not to just return to the Bradford Inn with is charming personality and unmatched hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little Gem”
Reviews.Author: dbrown49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in Branson and loved the fact that Bradford Inn is off the crazy busy streets of Branson but close enough to enjoy the sites and sounds the town has to offer. The staff is fantastic and very accommodating. The breakfast was superb. We would definitely stay there again when we return to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: ARgat0r
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have passed this hotel on our way to Silver Dollar City, and I've always thought it looked like a nice place to stay. So on this visit, we did and we were not disappointed. It was an incredible value for what you get. Big clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a wonderful breakfast included. This hotel is away from the main srip of Branson, which in my opinion is MUCH better. On a summer weekend, the traffic on the strip is a nightmare, so we were pleased not to be in the middle of all that. It was very quiet, and it had a beautiful view of the surrounding hills and a nice view of Branson. We had a basic double queen room on the bottom floor. It had a small area in front with chairs to sit. When we stay here in the future, we may opt for a room on the 2nd or 3rd level to gain some better views, but our 1st floor room was still pleasant. There is a large gazebo/patio area for all hotel guests to use as well. The breakfast was better than I expected. Eggs were made to order as well as waffles. You helped yourself to fresh fruit, fruit salad, sausage, several different types of coffee cakes, cinnamon rolls, and muffins. There was also cereal and bagels available. When we come to Branson again, we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodations, staff and property!!”
Reviews.Author: fishforfun
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I had a "girls only" weekend in Branson. We stayed at the Loft at the Bradford Inn and it was perfect. The view from the deck was gorgeous. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast cooked to order. Also, they serve a lunch and have yummy desserts. We will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “If you're afraid of wasps, do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: TheCoops99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in April to celebrate our anniversary. Upon arrival, everything went well. This is a very charming place, and the location is great. The lady checking us in was very friendly, and the process was smooth and easy. When we got into our room, I was quite disappointed to see that although the picture on the website showed our room as having a four poster bed, it did not. Also, I did not realize that there was no separate shower, just the one in the jacuzzi tub. We were excited to see a nice gazebo with a wonderful view, overlooking Branson. However, that excitement was short-lived when we sat down to enjoy the view and quickly had several wasps flying around our faces. This place has what I would call an infestation of wasps. I understand that it's spring, and that there are going to be wasps around, but this was excessive. They are everywhere, all over the gazebo and flying right outside the door to our room. We took a walk around the property, and we could see wasps nests up in the eaves of the buildings, with numerous wasps flying all around them. Who wants to be stung by wasps while on vacation? The breakfast is your standard fare; eggs, Jimmy Dean sausage patties, biscuits and gravy, waffles, fruit, etc. The man preparing it wasn't overly friendly. The eating area was very, very crowded, so we ended up eating out on the deck, but that was nice. Our second morning there we went to Grand Country for breakfast, as we didn't want to contend with the crowd. The parking here is limited. I don't think we were ever able to park in front of our room. On the positive side, the bed was very, very comfortable. The housekeeping service was good. The jacuzzi tub was relaxing. The price was reasonable. However, given the wasp situation and the fact that our room was just your average, Super 8 style room, we probably will not return. I think we will stick with Aunt Sadie's when it comes to Branson B&B's.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bed and Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: javamamma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bradford Inn between Dec 27th-Jan. 1st. We were very impressed with the Bradford Inn. It took me 3 months to select a place to stay in Branson and we were not sorry at all. We left believing that we had made the right choice. The location is absolutely beautiful and it was a very pleasant and relaxing respite before heading back to work the following week. We divided our stay between the Carriage Room and the Secret Garden Room. The Carriage room was my favorite! I was a bit dissapointed that the jacuzzi tub and the fridge did not work in the Secret Garden, but it did not hamper our fun. I loved the fact that my daughter used the seperate sitting room as her own private retreat. She had her toys and games spread everywhere in her own space. These rooms were almost more like private apartments to me, although I believe the rooms all differ and do not all have sitting rooms. I travelled with my mother in law and 8 yr. old daughter. Greg made us breakfast everyday and it was delicious. He was super pleasant and fun to talk to. It was also fun to talk to people who were super friendly and from other parts of the country during breakfast time. Breakfast was generally the same menu every morning and we loved it! Eggs made to order, biscuits and gravy (my fav.), fruit compote, waffles, some mornings were coffee cakes, pastry items, cereals, juice and the coffee was GREAT. I am a very picky regular Starbucks customer so if I like the coffee- it's saying a lot. Overall, we loved our stay and hope to return to the Bradford Inn someday. I would also like to add the fact that the Bradford is just outside of town which I find to be a bonus, because you are away from all of the hustle bustle and traffic. I was not at all impressed with the looks of the many dated looking hotels in town that looked cramped. I shudder at the thought that I almost chose a couple of those places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Away from it all.”
Reviews.Author: BilboKcmo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bradford Inn quite a few times now and the only disappointment is the times we have stopped and there wasn't a room available. We love the rooms. We have stayed in a few of them. But mostly we like the location of the inn. It is away from all the hustle and bustle of Branson. It is out in the quiet countryside and has a beautiful view overlooking the city of Branson. Love it at night when all the lights are twinkling.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome find”
Reviews.Author: TexarkanaLisa
Reviews.Content: Myself and my teenager traveled to Branson for the third time. This trip by far was the BEST. We both loved the Bradford Inn. The location was awesome and the price was fair. I had seen this Inn from afar the last time we were in Branson, and I told myself "Our next trip, we will stay there", And yep, we did !! And I am tickled we did. I wanted to shop on our second day downtown on Main, and MY TEENAGER said "mom i really like this Inn can i stay here". He loved being in the safe and cozy room. And if he need a snack the newly opened Bakery/Deli was open. The view was OFF THE CHAIN. I would recommend this Inn to anyone who wants a low key/quiet vacation. LUV LUV the no smoking policy no pets no noises after 10p....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dawgpound1910
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews about the Bradford Inn and the older owner not being too friendly, that was not the case. We were greeted by a high-school girl (probably the owner's daughter), and at breakfast the owner (a middle-aged man and probably the older owner's son or son-in-law) was the very friendly cook. We stayed in the Gothic Room. It was nice with an electric fireplace, jacuzzi tub in the bay window, large bathroom, great king-sized bed, etc. The ONLY negative thing I have to say about the Bradford (and reason why it gets 4 stars and not 5) is that many things in the room seem very old and could be fixed very easily. There are quite a few marks and dings in the wall that need to be touched up, the a/c unit is an old one that cheaper hotel rooms use that must remain on constantly if you want it cool, the mini fridge needed defrosting and the temperature nob in it was broken off, and in the jacuzzi tub one of the knobs was missing. So, nothing that's going to make you not want to stay there, but there were quite a few small things that could easily be fixed up. The maid servis was great, every day the room was vacuumed, had new towels and the bed was done up very nicely. Also, the view from the Gothic room was amazing! One last thing, the Bradford has a 'quiet time' that goes from 10pm-8am (or somewhere around then), where guests must not make much noise so others aren't disturbed, which we liked a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Branson to stay”
Reviews.Author: HTrewern
Reviews.Content: The Bradford Inn is hands down, the best place in Branson to stay. The rooms and facilities are charming. The staff are very hospitable. The breakfast is to die for. The grounds are well keeped. The gazebo over looking Branson is peaceful and relaxing. I am so very excited for the grand opening of their restaurant. And the owners are enchanting. My husband and I love the Inn, and consider it a home away from home. A stay at the Bradford Inn will greatly enhace any traveler's experience in Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, cozy and clean”
Reviews.Author: clarmst
Reviews.Content: What a great find this is! Convenient location, but in a quiet setting. Nicely decorated. A great value and the breakfast was amazing. There was even free wi fi. This was our first visit, but it definitely won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be our favorite... not anymore”
Reviews.Author: Jenerator325
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bradford in Fall of 2009 and really enjoyed it. We attempted to stay there again over Easter weekend. The property was as lovely as ever and the pear trees were in full bloom. They seemed to have a problem with wasps and bees. I realize that it's spring but the room we were in had it's own entrance and looking out the window you could see at any given time 10 or 15 wasps outside the door. I was not pleased and we alerted the desk staff and were given another room. The room was alright, but the buildings are a little shabbier than I recall them being last year. I had hoped the owners would use the winter off-season to repair the property but they did not. We stayed one night at the Bradford and after basically not being able to wash my hair with the shower head and dodging wasps in and out to our car we'd had enough. We inquired about the cancellation policy and were informed that they wouldn't refund any of our money regardless of why we were leaving. That policy is posted on the website, but we asked anyway since we were leaving early because of the hotel itself. We decided to waste the 2 additional nights we had paid for and go to another property on Indian Point in the same price range with much better facilities. We really enjoyed the hotel last Fall, but after this experience we will not be back, and will caution friends against booking a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: 4x4travel
Reviews.Content: Repeat guests. Great bed, great room, great view. FULL breakfast made to order -- free. Room is a bargain -- throw in the breakfast it is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaitlynkec
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time on my honeymoon. My husband had stayed on previous trips with the church and suggested it as a nice, cozy place to stay. We stayed in room 19, I believe its the violet room. The staff was very friendly. Breakfast was delicious all 3 days we stayed there. We are going back this year for our first anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Missourimommaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming to Branson for over 20 years now. I used to drive by the Bradford Inn and say "We need to stay there sometime." But as young newly weds I always thought it would be too expensive. One day my husband decided we needed to check it out. The lady at the desk was sooo sweet. She offered for us to look at several rooms that were available and decide which one we liked. We have been hooked ever since. I must say it is harder to get a room now than it was back then. The staff have always been warm and welcoming. We love the breakfast. We spend each Anniversary here. While my husband was deployed to Iraq I came by myself and stayed in the "hide away" room. I have also started a new tradition with my two friends and we stay in the Loft once a year. We love this place. No they don't have a hair dryer or some of the other frills, but I usually bring mine with me anyways so that doesn't matter. I don't like hotel shampoo and soap. Besides if you forget anything just let them know and they will get it for you. It doesn't have a pool but we really don't care about that. We have stayed in just about all the rooms they have and we have loved each one. I do have my favorites, like the hide away. Most recently we stayed in the Golf Room and really enjoyed the fire place. There is a timer on the fireplaces, which only go for 30 minutes. Would like for them to go longer or have none at all. But not a big enough problem to stop me from coming here each year. We have three daughters who have been coming here all their lives. My oldest is 17 years old. They love it as much as we do.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dentonjohn
Reviews.Content: Must say we had a great time. We stayed four nights starting Aug 11th. We drove into Branson without reservations and arrived at 6 PM. My wife fell in love with the place at first sight. It looked quite like a couple of New England inns we had stayed at. The desk clerk gave us the keys to the Secret Garden room. My wife didn't want to leave the room. Let's just say we found plenty to do in there with the double jacuzzi and queen sized bed. It was great seeing the view over Branson and watching the sun rise over the Ozarks from our balcony. The owners couldn't have been more cordial. They prepared a fine breakfast each morning, talked much about themselves and the inn, and gave advice on what to see and where to go. Great breakfast. Much better then say at an average Hampton Inn. Fresh eggs and sausage each morning. My wife being a vegetarian, found ample cereals, muffins, breakfast cakes, and such to fill her needs. We're really breakfast people and try to eat at fun and interesting places. In four mornings we never ate anywhere else. Between the view, quality of the breakfast, and the company we felt no need to venture elsewhere. My wife and I are 56 as of this writing. Married 37 years. We felt like newlyweds at this place......and played like it too. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lumay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here 3 or 4 times before. The Bradford Inn is a great option to the standard hotel stay in Branson. I find it important to know that the inn is built on a hill, with the rooms on the lowest level being "walk-out basement" rooms. The rooms above them are on the ground level (which is were you drive in off the highway) They also have rooms above the ground level rooms and a very few above them. The "walk-out basement" rooms are our least favorite. You drive around the inn, and down the hill and enter them from the rear. They resemble motel type rooms from the outside. Even though they are furnished deciently, they have an odd feel to them. I would highly recomend any of the rooms above them. When we brought are two kids, we booked the Eaves room - It is nice because there are basicly two small bedrooms that are connected with an open hallway with one small bathroom. As far as the furnishings- this is a FAMILY owned and operated INN. This is not a Westin or Hyatt. Everything has a homey feel to it, as though it is someone's own furnishings. Everything has always been very clean and functional. Take note when booking a room with a "jacuzzi". You can get one by itself, or you might get one that is part of the shower in your bathroom (not that appealing to us). I will say I have to agree with others on the staff not being the most friendly. Don't get me wrong, it's not like they are mean and grumpy old folks- I guess I just expect them to be really nice and they never are. Check-in has always seemed like it was a bit of a bother for them. Breakfast as well, I just for some reason or another, expect to be greeted by these talkative, happy people and we never are. (Please don't stay there because of that.... It's just my quirky observation) The food has always been good- 7:30 to 9:30 is the time allowed. (7;30-10:00) would be nice for late risers. You will have to check-out an iron at the front desk, kind of annoying since there is already a board in the room. Also, for you exercisers - there is really no place to walk/run, unless you drive and park your car some where. The Inn is located on a busy road, with no shoulder to walk or run on.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful spot, homey and close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jetz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mom and we both were quite comfortable. The rooms are nicely furnished, not overdone, fancy or fussy - just homey and comfortable. I was able to book the exact rooms I wanted and chose one handicap accessible for mom and one w/a Jacuzzi for my bad back. The jacuzzi was what the manufacturer calls 2-person, which does really mean two slim persons, but I was there alone so it was plenty roomy for me. Mom's handicap accessible room featured roll in shower and hand rails. The rooms were clean, but in some cases could use a bit of touch up paint. Breakfast was served in a sunny, large dining area. Owners cooked eggs or waffles to order and also offered fresh fruit, cereal, coffee cakes, beverages and more. We loved the country setting of the inn and preferred this to staying closer to the strip or in a chain hotel. The theaters and restaurants were 5 minutes away and it was easy to get to the Yellow, Red and Green routes that keep you from sitting so long on the strip. The view of the lake is better from one side of the Inn than the other and from rooms on the higher floors, so if that is important to you, ask for a room w/lake view and if available they will oblige.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Katlyn2
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Bradford Inn was amazing. I was greeted with warmth and treated with the utmost respect. Their breakfast was wonderful. I loved the cinnamon rolls, eggs and sausage. Great coffee. I travel all over the United States and have never slept in such a comfortable bed. The view over Branson is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Great”
Reviews.Author: TexasZuggie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent only one night here. We were disappointed with this property. We had read all the great reviews and I guess our expectations were greater than the reality of this place. Our room was OK, but it was sparcely furnished. had no view of the mountains. We did not have a coffee maker in the room. There was no hairdryer, or shampoo for that matter. We had an ironing board but no iron. These things we have become accustomed to having for our convenience. So be sure you bring everything you may need prior to booking this place. I guess what I am saying is there was no attention to details here. The breakfast was OK, but far from great. It consisted of coffee cakes from the freezer section at the discount warehouse, and fruit from a can. They did make good waffles while you waited. Breakfast was served on paper plates and you ate with plastic forks. I have had better breakfast at Holiday Inn Express. The innkeepers were not the warm and welcoming people that we had seen mentioned in other reviews. In fact the lady at the front desk never smiled, never welcomed us, and never mentioned what the property had to offer. She was more concerned with going over the rules of the property and having us sign a statement that we knew the rules of the property. Not a real warm fuzzy moment. More like going off to summer camp with the camp counselor from Hell. I am not sure if she was the Innkeeper, she never identified nor introduced herself to us. With all the choices for lodging in Branson, we will not go back to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: OSUVal
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The room was spotless. The towels were large and thick (not your typical small and thin towels found at most hotels). The view was absolutely awesome! They fixed a wonderful breakfast (the waffles were out of this world!) and you could eat as much or as little as you like. A great variety for the breakfast, too (eggs, waffles, fruit, cereal, coffee cake, and more). It was our first time staying at a bed and breakfast. My husband and I would highly recommend this place and will definitely stay there again. Plus, it's close to Silver Dollar City. If you stay here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: scdlockelady
Reviews.Content: Oh My!! The Bradford Inn is the best. We just recently returned from an all girl shopping trip. We stayed in the guest house for two nights which was wonderful. There were seven(5 adults and 2 children) of us in this house and we were never in each others way. Plenty of comfortable beds for everyone. The screened in deck with a view of Branson was priceless!! The rate for this beautiful house was very reasonable!! Also the FREE breakfast they cook for you in the morning is tasty! I am not really a "Branson Person" (I don't care for shows, etc) but I do enjoy shopping and I wouldn't rate Branson in my top 10 favorite places to shop but the Bradford Inn was so wonderful I am already planning another trip!! I truly cannot think of one negative comment. I highly recommend the guest house!!! You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Bradford Inn”
Reviews.Author: obitwriter
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights in Branson at the Bradford Inn. I had been looking forward to staying there after viewing their website. I must say I was a little disappointed. I guess I was expecting a room with a little extra. Our room was just like a regular motel room. The bathroom was small and the "two person" jacuzzi would have been a tight fit for two people. We were in the north building and did not have a view - trees in the way. It looked like the south building had a great view. I felt like I could have paid less elsewhere and gotten the same type room. The room and facilities were clean and well kept. The breakfast was great and the owners were very friendly. The location was very convenient to Silver Dollar City and it did not take us long to get to the Strip either. I just thought I was getting something more than a standard motel room.

Reviews.Title: “felt like a home”
Reviews.Author: ladete2
Reviews.Content: This Inn is a lovely home nestled in trees with a great view. It was quiet and peaceful and very clean. The owner was very friendly, helpful, and he prepares an outstanding breakfast! I appreciated being a little removed from the concrete and lights of the strip, yet we were still minutes away from the shows.

Reviews.Title: “"Bang For Your Buck"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Bradford Inn is an excellect place to stay at a reasonable price. My partner and I were happy when entering our room (wistera) to see that it was clean, comfortable and spacious. This B and B overlooks branson and is great for catching the fireworks provided nightly by a nearby amusement park. The grounds of the Bradford are filled with colorful gardens and shrubs. The service is just right. No 8 o'clock wake up calls. The breakfast is deliciously prepared by a friendly innkeeper. Would definitly reccommed to a couple on a budget who want a peaceful trip located near many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Be_as_you_are
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of you who posted a review about the Bradford Inn because we took your advice and stayed there Friday, Nov. 18, 2005. We stayed in the Secret Garden Room (one disappointment - the jacuzzi wouldn't turn on - darn!) The room was spacious and the fireplace was SO warm that we had to turn it off and open windows after a little while! The view was INCREDIBLE!! The Secret Garden room is on the end of the building - so there was nothing to clutter the view. What a beautiful Fall morning! Breakfast was great and everyone was SUPER friendly! We saw Cirque on Friday night - pretty good show - especially since it was FREE with some connections we have (we live just north of Branson). The best part of the Bradford is the PRICE! It was $89 for a Friday night when Big Cedar was asking either $149 or $269. YIKES! The room wasn't your standard hotel room - and we liked that. One cool thing they have is a journal in each room where past guests could write about their experience. It was interesting to see the entries from past guests - especially the one written the evening of September 11, 2001. Anyway - I HIGHLY recommend it! It is reasonably priced, close to the strip but not RIGHT on it so traffic wasn't bad and it only took a few minutes to get to the strip. Book it - you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: karenlynn
Reviews.Content: Nice room, clean, king size bed with jacuzzi, fireplace, great view from balcony, great value for $89 a night. Breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Bradford Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the Bradford Inn for a weekend getaway from the kids. We had a great time! The room was nicely furnished and the Jacuzzi tub was awesome!! Breakfast was really good also. Only negative was that we were on the bottom floor and the room above us was very noisy. Next time I will get a room on the upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking forward to our trip to Branson b/c it was supposed to be cold (the weekend after Thanksgiving). I checked this site and decided to try the Bradford. The price alone was wonderful! We were very impressed with our room and stayed warm with the fireplace. Too warm, actually! Our only complaint with the room was that the fold out sofa bed was literally only 2 inches thick. My husband and son weren't exactly comfortable, but they slept. The jacuzzi was huge, the room was clean, King size bed was comfortable, the view was fantastic and breakfast was great. We are very wary of hotels in Branson as some places tend to not be so well cared for, but we would definitely go back to the Bradford Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The service was great. The view of Bransons lights and fireworks display made this a mini vacation to remember. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Have always loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We average staying at the Bradford at least two times a year for several days each time. We enjoyed their service and the rooms so much we have taken visiting relatives to it on several occassions and have always been pleased. Five years ago we started bringing my husbands family reunion there and have always had rave reviews from all. The familes come from Kansas, Missouri, Tennesse, Mississippi, Arkansas and Indiana. Each year we plan to meet again at the Bradford. Part of the fun is getting a different style room each time. Bob and his breakfasts are wonderful and always hot and fresh. I would recommend the Bradford to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As one of our wedding gifts we received a nights stay in the Bridal Suite. We loved it so much we decided to stay another night. The breakfast is fantastic and the charm of the inn is fabulous! My husband and I would definately recommend this place to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased/ Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many inns/B&B's in the past. This is a great cross between the two and one of the nicest we have stayed at. The breakfasts were great and the rooms very clean. The inn is also very centrally located to all that Branson has to offer/ without being right in the business of the strip. My wife and I gave this 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Bugged out...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Bradford Inn several times and have always been very pleased. We thought we had finally found our "home away from home". However, our last stay at the Bradford was not so pleasant. We checked into the Wisteria room around 8 pm, and my husband and two children took their showers and watched television for awhile. After my husband and youngest son fell asleep in the king size bed, my oldest son folded out the sofa sleeper and began reading. After about half an hour, he came in and said, "Something bit me." He had several bites on his back and arms. I went in and saw several bugs crawling in his pillows and on the bed. I returned to the king size bed and also found several small bugs in the pillows and on the bed there. I woke my husband and he went immediately to the innkeeper, who promptly gave us The Pheasant Room downstairs. The next day we did a little "research" and discovered the bugs in our room were bedbugs. While in the Pheasant Room, we misplaced the remote control. I looked under the bed and found two empty soda bottles, and the post cap to the bed. I also found three porn magazines and dirty underwear in a dresser drawer, not to mention the dirty wadded up grocery bag in the tv stand. Our visits there had always been so pleasant and we were really disappointed. We had to fumigate our luggage and many of the items we had taken with us as a precautionary measure, before bringing our belongings back into our home. It was a disappointing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Bradford Inn is located atop a small mountain/large hill overlooking Branson from the west. We watched the fireworks from the balcony each night from Celebration City below. The rooms at the Bradford are well worth the price. We particularly liked the French Room. Some rooms, like the French, have a two-person jacuzzi. Very romantic. All the balcony's are somewhat shared (no privacy), however, hardly anyone was out there either in the morning or evening. We had a home cooked breakfast every morning (7:30-9:30), and coffee is ready by 7:00. Best time to ride the "strip" to plot/plan everything by car is early morning - especially before 10:00. After that, there are two or three alternate routes that go above and below the city. Once you get to know these routes, navigating is a snap. The best shows we saw were Jimmy Osmond, Shoji Tabuchi, Country Tonite, Jim Stafford, and Legends. We saw other shows too, but these were the best. We felt the train ride was not worth it. Not much to see as everything is overgrown. You must visit the Candlestick Inn for lunch (dinner is expensive). Great view, great food, and great lunch prices. Downtown, Mr. B's for ice cream! We didn't visit Silver Dollar City or Celebration City as they're more geared for children with a lot of rides (roller coasters, etc.). There's a Subway across from the Stone Hill Winery, and great pizza at Luigi's, which is in a strip mall across from the Lawrence Welk Theatre. All in all, a great vacation :-)

Reviews.Title: “great b&b”
Reviews.Author: mcavStCharles_Mo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Bradford Inn twice and have enjoyed our stay both times. Each room has its own theme. Both of our rooms had a jacuzzi. The rooms are of decent size and very clean. Great views. The breakfast is very good and the staff is very friendly. Highly recommend.

HotelInfo.Name: Bradford Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3590 State Hwy 265, Branson, MO 65616
